settings.subtitle: Food allergies occur when the immune system mistakenly identifies a specific protein in food as harmful, leading to an allergic reaction. The most prevalent food allergens include peanuts, tree nuts, milk, eggs, wheat, soy, fish, and shellfish. Symptoms can vary widely, from mild hives and itching to severe anaphylaxis. It's important for individuals with food allergies to avoid their triggers and to be prepared with medications such as antihistamines or epinephrine auto-injectors in case of accidental exposure
